subjectDescription: Discover a full suite of online business courses that will allow you to make better business decisions and succeed in today's competitive business world. Our courses provide a rich learning experience that will allow you to develop critical business skills in areas such as business... Read more...
title: Getting Started With SAP Fiori
headline: In this free online course, you will learn to use SAP Fiori to improve business processes and redefine the way you work.
description: Are you or your employees seemingly frustrated with traditional enterprise resource planning applications that make your career more stressful? This short introductory course will explore how to access and use SAP Fiori to reduce the time needed to complete your job and improve your productivity. Discover how to use the Fiori built-in workflows to enhance your business processes and redefine the way you and your team work. Sign up today!
courseDescription:
SAP Fiori is a modernized software suite that delivers a role-based user experience (UX) that cuts across several industries and devices. It offers cross-device technology that allows users to access the optimized web and mobile applications with improved data quality and peerless productivity. It also provides functionalities that help developers adapt and scale their custom development seamlessly and rapidly. In addition, Fiori allows users to handle numerous business tasks like generating invoices, creating purchase orders and finding new business opportunities.

In this free online course, you will learn how to navigate the menu in the SAP graphical user interface (GUI). We will examine the difference between the ‘technical’ catalog and the ‘business’ catalog in the SAP suite. Study how to use tile groups, also known as ‘business groups’, that contain tiles from a business catalog. Learn how to work with the Fiori Launchpad to define roles that assign business catalogs and business groups to users. Moreover, the course presents practical demonstrations of the Fiori user experience (UX) in an easy-to-understand manner.

Finally, you will learn to master the Fiori Launchpad Content Manager, Launchpad Designer and Launchpad Personalization. Whether you’re learning about Fiori for the first time or are already preparing for the SAP certification, you will gain extensive knowledge that will give you a competitive advantage over your peers. This course aims to transform a regular user into an SAP expert with simple lessons that can help redefine how you work. So why wait? Start learning right away.

Start Course Now
certificateDetail:
All Alison courses are free to enrol study and complete. To successfully complete this course and become an Alison Graduate, you need to achieve 80% or higher in each course assessment. Once you have completed this course, you have the option to acquire an official Diploma, which is a great way to share your achievement with the world.

Your Alison is:
  • Ideal for sharing with potential employers
  • Include it in your CV, professional social media profiles and job applications.
  • An indication of your commitment to continuously learn, upskill & achieve high results.
  • An incentive for you to continue empowering yourself through lifelong learning.
Alison offers 3 types of Diplomas for completed Diploma courses:
  • Digital : a downloadable in PDF format immediately available to you when you complete your purchase.
  • : a physical version of your officially branded and security-marked , posted to you with FREE shipping.
  • Framed : a physical version of your officially branded and security marked in a stylish frame, posted to you with FREE shipping.

All are available to purchase through the Alison Shop. For more information on purchasing Alison , please visit our FAQs. If you decide not to purchase your Alison , you can still demonstrate your achievement by sharing your Learner Record or Learner Achievement Verification, both of which are accessible from your Dashboard. For more details on our pricing, please visit our Pricing Page
slides:
• Learning Outcomes

  • After completing this module, you will be able to:
    • Distinguish the SAP Easy Access from the Fiori Launchpad
    • Recognize the technical and business catalogs in the SAP suite
    • Describe a tile group with their naming convention
    • Identify the frontend and backend roles in the Fiori interface
    • Describe how Fiori Launchpad Manager and Launchpad Designer improve the user experience
    • Explain how to create a catalog and business role
    • Discuss Fiori Launchpad personalization and tile definition

  • Fiori Launchpad, Catalogs and Roles

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Fiori Launchpad, Catalogs and Roles

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Fiori Launchpad, Catalogs and Roles

  • Launchpad Designer and Tile Definition

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Launchpad Designer and Tile Definition

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Launchpad Designer and Tile Definition

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Lesson Summary

  • The key points from this module are:

    SAP Easy Access and SAP Fiori Launchpad
    A tile is attached to a URL, and the URL allows you to start the Launchpad application. With the URL, you can launch the application using the browser. You will not know all the URLs of every application you want to start, so you will use the Fiori Launchpad to launch your applications.
  • Technical catalogues and business catalogues
    1. 1.  Developers store tile definitions in a technical catalogue. A technical catalogue bundles tiles by components. The technical catalogue delivered by Sap begins with SAP_TC_.
    2. 2.  A business catalogue is a subset of a technical catalogue and contains tiles that are relevant to a specific role. The business catalogue references the tiles in a technical catalogue.
    3. 3.  The business catalogue delivered by SAP uses the naming convention SAP_xxx_BC_xxxxxx.
  • Tile groups
    1. 1.  A tile group is sometimes called a business group. A business group contains tiles from a business catalogue that should be displayed as standard when the Fiori Launchpad is started.
    2. 2.  Tiles are grouped optically within a group and are given a group heading.
    3. 3.  Alternatively, a tile can be visualized as a link.
